name: sfchronicle
text: San Mateo County recorded another 31 cases of the coronavirus on Saturday, bringing its case total to 3,083 so far. The county’s COVID-19 fatality count remained at 106. https://t.co/6IuQK8qU1u

name: sfchronicle
text: "By passing up the polished but slightly deadening gloss that comes with studio recording, Thomas and the orchestra have opted instead for a sense of immediacy and urgency." Take a look at the best recordings of Michael Tilson Thomas's work here: https://t.co/3LfBzEaqXO

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The U.S. added 44,782 new coronavirus cases on Saturday, marking a new record. It's the second day in a row that new cases have risen above 40,000.  https://t.co/W1QA1haJnl

name: sfchronicle
text: A man used a golf club to shatter the windows of the Oakland LGBTQ Community Center this morning. The organization's co-founder says it was a targeted attack on Pride weekend. https://t.co/xwHCEGxzzg

name: sfchronicle
text: “They can smash our windows, they cannot smash our spirit, our pride, and the fact that this Bay Area is a sanctuar… https://t.co/KQKZ6kDYrG

name: sfchronicle
text:
Tired of the late-night/early-morning fireworks?

Complaints are pouring in all over the region, but the East Bay seems to be seeing the biggest boom. “The fireworks seem to be bigger, louder, stronger.”

 https://t.co/WMOgYer38x

name: sfchronicle
text: Governor Newsom, California's top Democrat, was left out as lawmakers picked leaders for the state's delegation to the Democratic National Convention in August. https://t.co/T0UkEoapxw

name: sfchronicle
text:
“The secret ingredient in Michael Tilson Thomas' artistic leadership hasn’t been a disregard for tradition, but rather a determination to keep that tradition alive and spontaneous and unpredictable,” Joshua Kosman writes.

name: sfchronicle
text:

text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/pzYqdcO9zJ

name: sfchronicle
text: Charter schools are exempt from many state regulations, yet still receive state funding. Some of the Bay Area charters that got millions in federal bailout money are also backed by Silicon Valley billionaires. https://t.co/6GGKo32UXC

name: sfchronicle
text:
Fresh produce from local farms that usually ends up at Bay Area restaurants is now being packed for farmworkers and other low-income employees.
https://t.co/Ep8CF7chqS

name: sfchronicle
text: Would-be virus killer Dr. Nevan Krogan leads a UCSF team that — in the hunt for effective drugs — has found a new class of drug candidates that function through a different, powerful mechanism. https://t.co/ofwQ5zNf2U

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Pink Triangle, now marking its 25th anniversary as a symbol of love, hope and pride — reclaimed from a symbol of hate in Nazi Germany — was lit up last night amid a Pride season marked by distance and loss.
https://t.co/Pn3yqewhsJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
"I think the most exciting corners of American food today are happening in immigrant communities."
